data.title: Christopher Name Meaning: Origin, Popularity & Nicknames
data.meta_description: Learn about the name Christopher including the meaning, gender, origin, popularity, and more.
data.text:
What Does Christopher Mean?

Christopher is the English version of the Greek boy name Christophoros, also spelled Christoforos. The name is composed of two Greek words: “Christos” and “phérein.”

“Christos” translates literally to “anointed” or “anointed one.” Culturally, it alludes to Jesus Christ, the central figure of Christianity.

“Phérein” is a Greek verb that means “to bear” or “hold up.” Therefore, when put together, the name Christophoros and its variations mean “Christ-bearer” (1).

What Is the Origin of the Name Christopher?

The name Christopher can be traced back to Greek-speaking early Christians, who used the name Christophoros. It was likely used to signify one’s devotion to Jesus, evoking the idea that they carry Christ in their hearts.

As Christianity gained popularity throughout the centuries, common Christian names spread to various cultures. Notably, people in England started using the name Christopher as early as the fifteenth century.

English-speaking culture even developed a mythology around the name, such as the story of Saint Christopher, who is said to have carried Jesus over a body of water (2).

How Popular Is the Name Christopher?

The name Christopher has always had some popularity since it was first used in the fifteenth century. However, the last 50 years or so have seen a notable increase in parents naming their children Christopher.

Starting around 1940, the United States naming data shows a steady rise in the popularity of the name Christopher (3). From 1979 to 1994, Christopher remained the second most popular male baby name in the country.

Today, Christopher is still ranked in the top 50 most popular male baby names.

How Do I Pronounce Christopher?

Christopher is pronounced “kris-TUH-fer.” The “ch” is pronounced like the “ch” in “chorus,” not the “ch” in “church.” And the “ph” is pronounced like the “ph” in “physics,” not like the “p” in “pen.”

Is Christopher a Boy or Girl Name?

Historically, Christopher has been a common name for boys. Although it’s possible to use Christopher as a girl name, Christopher is currently an extremely popular boy name.

If you want a more classically feminine version of the name Christopher, you could try shortening it to “Chris” or “Christy.”

Variations of Christopher

There are many variations of the name Christopher. Some variations include:

Christoforos (Greek)

Christoffel (Dutch)

Christophorus (Latin)

Cristóbal (Spanish)

Cristoforo (Italian)

Kristof (Scandinavian)

Nicknames for Christopher

Christopher is a great name for nicknames. The most common nicknames for Christopher include:

Chip

Chris

Chrissy

Christie

Christo

Cris

Critter

Kit

Kris

Stoff

Toph

Topher

Similar Names to Christopher

Whether you want another traditional Christian name or a name with similar energy, there are plenty of options from which to choose. Here are some options:

Alexander

Archer

Christian

Christina

Christine

Cristina

Kristen

Oliver

Peter

Spencer

Tyler

Middle Names for Christopher

Since Christopher is such a classic name, many middle names go with it well. Some ideas include:

Aiden

Andrew

Beck

Blake

Charles

Cyrus

Damon

Edward

Elijah

Flynn

Jack

Jax

Mason

Saint

Scout

Shay

Wolf

Sibling Names for Christopher

When it comes to good sibling names for Christopher, you will have many options from which to choose.

For a brother:

Adrian

Collin

Eliot

Felix

Ian

Luke

Michael

Nathan

Nicholas

Philip

Simon

For a sister:

Abigail

Cora

Delaney

Elizabeth

Emily

Eve

Gabrielle

Martha

Mary

Natalie

Paisley

Famous People Named Christopher

There are various historical figures and celebrities with the name Christopher. Some of the most famous people named Christopher include:

Christopher Edwin Breaux: Musician, also known under the stage name Frank Ocean.

Chris Cillizza: Political commentator.

Christopher Columbus: Italian colonizer.

Christopher Cross: Singer.

Christopher Eccleston: Actor.

Chris Hayes: News anchor.

Chris Hemsworth: Actor.

Christopher Lloyd: Actor.

Christopher Marlowe: Playwright and poet.

Christopher Meloni: Actor.

Christopher Robin Milne: Son of A.A. Milne and namesake of the fictional character Christopher Robin.

Christopher Nolan: Director and producer.

Chris Pine: Actor.

Chris Pratt: Actor.

Christopher Plummer: Actor.

Chris Rock: Comedian.

Christopher Walken: Actor.

Christopher Wallace: The Notorious B.I.G.

Chris Wallace: News anchor and broadcast journalist.

Saint Christopher: Catholic and Orthodox Christian saint.

Christopher in Popular Culture

As a prevalent name in English-speaking culture, Christopher has popped up quite frequently in fictional works. Some examples of fictional characters named Christopher are:

Chris Comer: Character in “Friday Night Lights.”

Chris Griffin: Character in “Family Guy.”

Christopher Harris: Character in “House Party” who was often called “Kid.”

Chris Miles: Character in “Skins.”

Christopher Moltisanti: Character in “The Sopranos.”

Chris Ostreicher: Character in “American Pie” who went by the nickname “Oz.”

Chris Partlow: Character in “The Wire.”

Christopher Pike: Character in “Star Trek.”

Chris Traeger: Rob Lowe’s character in “Parks and Rec.”

Christopher Turk: A character in “Scrubs” that usually went by his last name, Turk.

Christopher FAQs

Here are the answers to some of the most frequently asked questions about the name Christopher.
